item.title: Creating an academic website with blogdown
item.description: Overview I recently created a website in RStudio with blogdown using the Hugo academic theme and Netlify. Dan Quintana created a great post on this last year with VS Code, so I thought I’d create on for 2021 in RStudio. If you’re looking for instructions on how to setup a basic blogdown site (not academic), you can check out the post I wrote on Storybench. Read more about the academic theme in the documentation.

item.title: Creating an R package
item.description: This post is going to cover how to convert the split_into_multiple() function we wrote in the last post into a small R package. Read more about writing R packages in the R packages book Install and load the necessary packages Run the code below to install and load the necessary packages # install install.packages(c("devtools", "roxygen2", "testthat", "knitr", "tidyverse", "fs", "withr")) # load library(devtools) library(roxygen2) library(testthat) library(knitr) library(tidyverse) library(fs) library(withr) Creating the package We’ll use the IDE to create our new package by clicking on Project > New Project > R package, and then fill in the necessary information.
